form.name: form1

div.span: All Day Closure

span.div: Due to the threat of Coronavirus, the Bethel Park School District is CLOSED through the end of the 2019-2020 school year.

div.div: MISSION: To lead an educational partnership with the Community, maintaining an environment that challenges all students to reach their potential as lifelong learners and responsible members of society.

div.div: Welcome to the Bethel Park School District

a.title: Schools Closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year

img.title: Schools Closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year
img.alt: Schools Closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year

div.span: Due to the spread of the Coronavirus, the Bethel Park School District will be closed until further notice. This page was updated on Tuesday, April 14.
The Bethel Park School District's Continuity of Education Program will continue through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Please click here to see the Program for the Fourth Quarter.
Please click here to learn more about the Coronavirus from various health organizations.
The Bethel Park Board of School Directors will hold their April Regular Meeting, using a virtual format on April 28. Please click here to learn how you can watch the meetings.

h3.a: Referendum Question Removed From June 2 Primary Election Ballot

div.span: The Bethel Park Board of School Directors has voted to remove the Referendum Question from the June 2 Primary Election Ballot
If you have not registered your child for Kindergarten yet, please click here to learn how.

h3.a: Bethel Park Receives Best Communities For Music Education Award

div.span: For the fifth time, the Bethel Park School District received the Best Communities for Music Education Award from the National Association of Music Merchants.

h3.a: Freshman Earns Scholarship To Study In Germany

div.span: Bethel Park High School Freshman Cody Hendrych-Bondra earned a scholarship to live and study in Germany.

h3.a: BPHS Students Win Two Awards At Science Olympiad

div.span: Bethel Park High School students won two awards at the Science Olympiad.

a.title: The three students at the America Bowl

img.title: The three students at the America Bowl
img.alt: The three students at the America Bowl

h3.a: Elementary Gifted Team Finishes Third In Amera Bowl

div.span: A team of three Bethel Park Elementary Gifted Students finished in Third Place in the America Bowl Competition.

h3.a: IMS Students Finish In Second In Science Bowl

div.span: A team of Independence Middle School students finished in Second Place in their Division at the Southwestern PA Science Bowl.

h3.a: Five Students Named Top Of The Shop

div.span: Five Bethel Park High School students were named Top of the Shop by Steel Center for the First Semester.

h3.a: Three Musicians Selected For Region Band

div.span: Three Bethel Park High School musicians were selected to play in the PMEA Region Band.

h3.a: Five BPHS Students Recognized For Work On National Latin Exams

div.span: Five Bethel Park High School students were recognized for their high scores on the National Latin Exams.
The Bethel Park School District hired Dr. Joseph Dimperio as its Interim Superintendent.

h3.a: IMS Students Take Second Place In Design Challenge

div.span: Three Independence Middle School students earned Second Place at the WQED Design Lives Here Competition.

The illegal use of copyrighted software by students and staff is prohibited. Any data uploaded to or downloaded from district systems shall be subject to fair use guidelines. Any original work created for use within the district shall remain under the ownership of the Bethel Park School District. If you believe content posted on the website violates copyright laws, please email [email protected] The district does not have any Title I served school buildings in School Improvement.
